original_conversation.content: [hesitantly] I don't know if you remember me, but, um... I was in your ER five years ago. [nervous] March 17th, 2019. [pause] Car accident on Route 9. [emotional] You probably see so many people, I wouldn't expect you to— [short pause] but I had to find you. [warm] I've actually been trying to track you down for, er... for months now. [crying while speaking] You told me I was going to be okay when I was... when I was bleeding out and terrified. [shaky voice] My kids were only three and five then. [pause] And you just kept talking to me, kept me conscious while you worked on my— [emotional] on my chest. [crying while speaking] The other nurses said you wouldn't leave my side even when your shift ended. [warm] I just... I needed to say thank you. [extremely happy] My daughter just started middle school. [emotional] My son's learning guitar. [crying while speaking] And I'm here for all of it because of you. [pause] So, um... thank you. subject: A former patient tracking you down to thank you for saving their life during your emergency room shift five years ago
